reviewText: Combining my favorite game genres, Stalker is an FPSRPG you just shouldn't miss. A prequel to Shadow of Chernobyl, it takes a lot of maps from the original game and a few new areas of its own, with a new twist and improved gameplay mechanics.  It's unique system creates gameplay scenarios you really can't find anywhere else. A game worth playing if you enjoy survival games.\n\nThere are plenty of mods to choose from as well, but if you want to play a modded game, you'll usually have to start a new one. You can't decide in the middle of the game you don't like something, and go find a mod to fix it, most require a fresh start entirely. Definitely do-able without mods, though there are some frustrating things that were never fixed (like NPC nade spam) and some bugs or quirks to address. Doesn't hurt to do a little reading up first, to decide if you'd like a vanilla or modded experiance your first time through.

reviewText: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky, is the prequel to S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl, a first-person shooter survival horror video game with RPG elements by Ukrainian developer GSC Game World. The game consists of a roughly 50/50 mix of new areas and old, remodeled areas from the previous game. The X-ray graphics engine has been updated to version 1.5 and includes DirectX 10 support . Additionally, the AI received an overhaul to accommodate the new faction wars feature.

reviewText: Combining my favorite game genres, Stalker is an FPSRPG you just shouldn't miss. A prequel to Shadow of Chernobyl, it takes a lot of maps from the original game and a few new areas of its own, with a new twist and improved gameplay mechanics.  It's unique system creates gameplay scenarios you really can't find anywhere else. A game worth playing if you enjoy survival games.\n\nThere are plenty of mods to choose from as well, but if you want to play a modded game, you'll usually have to start a new one. You can't decide in the middle of the game you don't like something, and go find a mod to fix it, most require a fresh start entirely. Definitely do-able without mods, though there are some frustrating things that were never fixed (like NPC nade spam) and some bugs or quirks to address. Doesn't hurt to do a little reading up first, to decide if you'd like a vanilla or modded experiance your first time through.

reviewText: An amazing game with tons of atmosphere and fun, when it works....  even now, years later, this game is still pretty buggy, and they even patched it yesterday (april 24, 2015).  often you will capture an objective and it will take a considerable amount of time before your backup shows up to progress the faction wars.  but when it does work, this game is absolutely amazing, and there are few games like it (although many have tried to mimic its strong points).  Stalker Call of Pripyat is very stable, and arguably a better game, but the maps are smaller, and there is less to do (still a lot though).  I love this game, I have logged over 100 hours in it, but if you are thinking about buying it and havent played call of pripyat, get that instead.

reviewText:
Game is very good, but very hardcore in gameplay if you play on master difficulty (and it is better to be played on master).

Visual part in vanilla game not so good already but pretty ok even today. With mod it is better.
Main plot is mediocre but open-world and fraction war is interesting. Lot of sidequests.

And if you plan to go on lower difficulty - don't do it. It is ruin game for you - couse NPC don't became weaker. Just some percent of bullets dessapear in air. Abd yours bullets too. It is really don't have very much sense.

It is recommended to use with Complete Mode Pack (unlike next game is STALKER series). Mode make lot of things better but not make changes in game. It  repair some bugs and add ability to avoid others. Plus with mod you have ability to skip time (sleep). It is essential because night is dark and full of terrors". And it isn't unrealistic because if you sleep not in camp you may die very easy from monster attack."

reviewText:
Played this one thru with the Clear Sky COMPLETE mod.

I guess the simplest thing to say about STALKER is that it has an amazing and engrossing atmosphere, but the game itself is marred by bugs and clunky implementation of mechanics.

Looting and surviving thru the hauntingly beautiful and dreadful zone is an experience worth having.  Putting up with a quest glitching, and having to go back 2 hours worth of gameplay to find a save that will reset it, is not...  Luckily the complete mod comes with a wish granter" cheat menu that can mitigate some of the bugs and flaws with mechanics.

Specifically
date: the faction wars in Clear Sky were pretty much broken for me.  When I joined Duty they would not take the first base after I cleared it.  So I was stuck with Freedom trying to kill me all game without any rewards for it.  It also broke the sense of isolation since you'd hear firefights breaking out every 4 or 5 minutes.   The final battle was an overly scripted inconsistent sort of mess.\n\n8/10"
hoursPlayed: true

reviewText: Stalker Clear Sky, like its predecessor Shadow of Chernobyl, is a post-apocalyptic survival-horror shooter taking place in the Zone of Exclusion around Chernobyl. Now, unlike its predecessor, Clear Sky has added certain new features that enhance the gameplay, such as the Factions War. In the game, multiple factions are vying for control of the Zone, and your character can join a group and help them secure the Zone, bringing in wealth, but also making new enemies, so choose wisely. Furthermore, the ability to repair and upgrade weapons and armor is now available to the player, allowing you to alter your equipment to best suit your play style. However, the story is quite frankly not as good as Shadow of Chernobyls, in my opinion. It lacks the intensity and depth that Shadow of Chernobyl has. I played this game with the Clear Sky Complete mod, which again fixes numerous bugs and noticeably improves graphics. All that in mind, this is a fantastic shooter, with several new features that set it apart from the original, although it doesn't quite measure up to the original in terms of atmosphere and story. Overall Score: 9.5/10

reviewText:
A lot of people have rightly said that Clear Sky was disappointing after Shadow of Chernobyl. I agree, mostly because a lot of the maps are just reworkings from the first game. Also, there is a little less depth in the story, tipping the scale into Clear Sky being more of a straight shooter.

However, the 'factions' war element brings something genuinely new to the game. Moreover, all the great visuals are still there and, when the new maps come along from time to time, they are still a real treat! I like the changes that have been made to the artifacts 'system' as well - there are fewer of them to be had, and they are harder (and more dangerous) to acquire. This adds value to their value.

If you have an itch to replay Chernobyl, but perhaps don't want to play through the exact same game again, get Clear Sky, especially if its on offer. Clear Sky proivdes enough of a difference for you to get your STALKER fix!

People tell me that Pripyat is even better again... I'm saving it though!

reviewText: Clear Sky is a strange mix of spectacular and infuriating. The new areas are excellent and provide a good start and end, while the areas reused from SoC get a slight face lift. Typical stalker gameplay {treasure hunting, mutant hunting, and man hunting} mesh well with the newly implemented faction wars. Claiming territory is fun and rewarding, though it occasionally. doesn't work. If you take an area alone, members of your faction will refuse to take it and smaller land grabs are often abandoned as soon as they are taken. The game crashes constantly for the first two hours of the game. Once you get past the first few missions, crashing becomes a rarity. Common bugs include weather changing when quick loading and enemies losing interest in you after quick loading. Grenades are especially evil this time around. Your grenades are difficult to aim and enemies will side step them easily. Enemies on the other hand, can snipe you with grenades. At one point a bandit 400 paces away killed me with a cooked grenade that hit me as I stood near a third floor window. This entry, having focued on turf warfare between humans, has much less mutant encounters than the other entries. Despite it's flaws, Clear Sky is still a damned good game, and worth paying about $5 to play.

reviewText: The middle child in the Stalker family, although the storyline happens before the original Stalker. Gameplay consists of same elements, that were in the original game. Survive the horrors of the zone, complete missions, gather better loot and avoid stability issues(:))\nSome things have changed; weapon/armor modifications, new faction, new areas and faction wars where you choose side and capture/defend strategic points and kill enemy soldiers in order to gain control of a part of the zone. Another new feature is the anomaly/artifact detector, which must be equipped in order to find artifacts.\nImo it is the worst of the stalker games, but its still pretty good game. There are lot of things to do in the vast zone, and surviving in hostile enviroment is always fun. My steam experience of the game turned out quite minimal, cause the game started crashing when i arrived in a certain place. This could be cause of a mod i installed, some of them arent optimized for steam, but they can really enhance the gaming experience. I have to recommend.

reviewText:
Im big on Clear Sky as some are critical of it. Dont get it twisted this game is TOUGH AS NAILS, you will die..over and over, not knowing how or why, grenade spam is REAL, Enemies bullets defy gravity and do matrix stuff to find you. If you play on veteran or master then you will break a computer component in frustration. you think dark souls is tough..Souls games cant hold a candle to this game especially. But yet i loved ever tortorous moment because i finished it. Also i havent played Call of Pripyat yet but played and completed Stalker Shadow of Chernobly and loved it..even though i didnt play it till mid 2015.
But Clear Sky is every bit of enjoyable with that sense of Immersion that a post apocalyptic game really can give you. Sound effects are gnarly, the added elements and different characters (well not design wise) and there personalities. Dangerous.. check, Immersive.. Check, great visuals with the dynamic lighting (if your rig supports).. Check, sound effects make your skin crawl...Check.
All the while if you play the first one you get to revisit these places but the this game clear sky is set a few years before Shadow of Chernobly. Its great to see how the Zone has changed from game to game..remebering where dangerous spots were before might not be there in the other game.
Love the Plot that the Zone (which is where the melt down occured) is living and breathing and has its own life force..how theres different factions fighting among each other over beliefs of the Zone, like some want to research it others want to kill everything in it. Hippies peace and love Yin Yang stuff..i finished game in 70 hours..death total...220. its BRUTAL
Great game 9/10

reviewText:
I found this game to be incredibly immersive... For the first 3 hours or so. I died within 30 seconds the first few attampts at the game. At first this was a challenge, then I learned the system, realized the game mechanics are weak and that the game became pointless.

1) I'm tired of my character stopping to pant and be out of breath after a 100 yard walk. Takes him 30 seconds to be out of breath and 30 seconds to regain it. Sprint is basically pointless as you must rest as much as you move.
2) I'm tired of the terrible loot system and the terrible fps physics -- forced to pick up trash loot before I can even see real loot (which further intensifies the 1st issue). The npcs have 100% accuracy on Normal difficulty, but I can't even consistently--at any distance point-blank, MR, or long range - with a rifle while 1 tapping.
3) I'm tired of fighting the same 3 enemy NPC's over and over - bandit, pig beast, dog beast - Only to receive the same bits of loot - pistol, sawed-off, hunting rifle (actually, it's a shotgun, but who's paying attention, right?), bandage, 1st aid kit, ammo. Pig and Dog never drop loot. Bandit drops loot I already have (x100) and over-encumbers me
4) Everything worth getting to requires taking the long route to avoid radiation. This is obviously annoying as the loot, stamina, and sprint functions are broke

reviewText: Disgusting point of no return for the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series.
voteText: No ratings yet 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
So Ive played about 9.1 hours

This contains minor spoilers possibly.

*************************Vanilla game-no mods whatsoever*************************************
Im where I need to get the documents for that science dude. Ive joined freedom and took the base (which they recaptured 10 minutes later but whatever).

I am good on money and got the Vintar and Veles from the Swamp. I use the Skat-9, Ak74, PKM, and have many meds. No artifacts. I sold them for upgrade. I think this is enough background info.

I am enjoying this game but it is, for sure, the weakest link in the series. I started with CoP, then SoC, now this. I came with little expectations with all the crap I heard about bugs. To be honest I havent seen to many.

When I tried to change my settings it crashed. Solution? Dont change every single thing at once. Worked for me.
When I caught a place for Clear Sky, I had to hold the point but it didnt do anything. Solution? Do F5 then F9 (quicksave/reload). That solved it. There are probably other bugs in the Factions War stuff but I havent seen them.

Other than that settings change crash it hasnt crashed once. This is actually less then SoC (which was also played vanilla only).

After coming from SoC I do like the mods and repair. Its just a shame this wasnt optimized/done better as it could have been the best in the series. Seems to be bigger world than CoP with all the mods and repair!

Others dont like they reused areas from SoC, but it IS half the price for a reason. I actually like it too. I feel like Im exploring my (as in strelok's) past going through it.

The story? I like it. But I liked all of them. I think they tie in nice. (Its all really about Strelok to a point)

I give it a 7.5/10  -  If you love S.T.A.L.K.E.R. then you should at the very least give it a chance. Im glad I did.

*It does feel a little less STALKER-y but its still fine. I can explain the less mutants since, you know, the Zone is younger and such. Hasnt expanded as far.
